com.server.jersey.aggregator

Class Android

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.server.jersey.aggregator.Android

  • @Path(value="android")
public class Android
extends java.lang.Object
    All android connections go through this class.
    Author:
    Kostas Skivalos and Nikos Gkountas

    • Method Detail

      • accept_credentials

        @POST
 @Path(value="/identification")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response accept_credentials(java.lang.String mys)
        Checking android login credentials sent as jsonobject
        Parameters:
        mys - Jsonobject string with credentials+some identification
        Returns:
        Status.Unauthorized if wrong credentials, status.ok if correct credentials,status.forbidden if server declined user,status.internal_server_error if exception occurs.

      • android_registration

        @POST
 @Path(value="/registration")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response android_registration(java.lang.String mys)
        Registering a new android device with username/pass
        Parameters:
        mys - Jsonobject in string format containing username and pass
        Returns:
        Status.forbidden if registered data already exists in database,status.internal_server_error in case of exception, else status.ok for accepted registration

      • SendSA

        @GET
 @Path(value="/get")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response SendSA(@DefaultValue(value="none") @QueryParam(value="SA")
                                                                                                       java.lang.String SA,
                                                                                                       @DefaultValue(value="0") @QueryParam(value="results")
                                                                                                       java.lang.String results)
        Returns SA results based on SA and amount of results.
        Parameters:
        SA - SA to return the results of, default is none
        results - Amount of last results returned
        Returns:
        Status.OK in all cases. If there were no results an empty jarray returns

      • SendSAInfo

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getSAInfo")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response SendSAInfo()
        Send all SA's with their respective info
        Returns:
        Jarray containing all SA's, or status.internal_server_error in case there was an exception.

      • stopSA

        @POST
 @Path(value="/sendjobs")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response stopSA(java.lang.String mys)
        Receiving either one or multiple: stop sa's,stop periodic jobs, new jobs android client created
        Parameters:
        mys - Accepts a jarray containing all the jobs. Each jsonobject in jarray has a {[hash],[job]} structure.
        Returns:
        A jarray {[hash],[response]} with the response for every jsonobject job that was sent. In case of at least 1 job causing an exception, return status.internal_server_error.

      • SendJobs

        @GET
 @Path(value="/getJobs")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response SendJobs()
        Sending all jobs that have been given by server to SA's.
        Returns:
        jarray with jsonobject {[hash],[job]} containing all jobs given for every SA. In case of exception return Internal_server_error
